data.title: Renewable energy technician (solar/wind)
data.text:
How to become a renewable energy technician

Solar energy systems engineers require a bachelorâ€™s degree, including coursework within engineering and technology, physics, mathematics, building and construction, and design. Technological skills that are important for a solar energy systems engineer are analytical or scientific software, computer-aided design (CAD) software, development environment software, object or component-oriented development software, and presentation software.

Wind turbine service technicians require post-secondary certificates in wind energy technology. Wind technology coursework includes maintenance instruction for electrical and hydraulic systems, braking and mechanical systems, and programmable logic control systems. When starting a job, on-site job training is typically required. Wind turbine service technicians can receive different certifications to demonstrate their knowledge, such as electrical safety and tower climbing. Important technological skills for this job include enterprise resource planning ERP software, industrial control software, presentation software, and spreadsheet software.

Role on a LEED project

LEED is the most widely used green building rating system in the world. Available for virtually all building types, LEED provides a framework for healthy, highly-efficient, and cost-saving green buildings. LEED certification is a globally recognized symbol of sustainability achievement and leadership.

Renewable energy technicians and engineers support renewable energy and green power goals of individual projects, utilities and governments. They may work on-site with project teams to assess the potential for on-site generation or the use of alternative green power, such as off-site generation or renewable energy certificates (RECs). Beyond a project team, renewable energy technicians and engineers support a low-carbon power grid, helping to meet government sustainability goals and supporting the ability of individual green buildings and projects to procure renewable energy. Renewable energy technicians will have the most impact on energy and atmosphere credits in LEED.
